intro: Copaifera cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf copaiba, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and produces a valuable resin used in traditional medicine and aromatherapy. The plant belongs to the Burseraceae family, known for its aromatic resins. Its growth is typically found in humid, lowland areas with rich soil. Copaifera cordifolia plays an important ecological role in supporting biodiversity within its native habitat.
